definition: according to the location/everywhere/any place/from any location/from wherever you like
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: It will happen by surprise in any place and time.
sentences.chinese: 它會隨時隨地且出奇不意地發生。

sentences.english: You leave me to go to glory; my sad heart will follow you everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 我這碎了的心，將隨時隨地與你同行。

sentences.english: You can read a book anywhere, any time.
sentences.chinese: 但書，你可以隨時隨地的翻閱。

sentences.english: Make positive self-suggestions whenever I can .
sentences.chinese: 隨時隨地地做積極的自我暗示。
她隨地吐痰，使人人感到厭惡。

sentences.english: The park is covered with old ca fantastics around with forms of garbage.
sentences.chinese: 公園裏隨地都是舊罐頭盒和其它各種渣滓。

sentences.english: Village leaders can arbitrarily "readjust" land rights at a moment's notice.
sentences.chinese: 村幹部可以隨時隨地任意“重新調整”土地使用權。

sentences.english: These 4 Kegel exercises are easy to do anywhere, anytime.
sentences.chinese: 這四項凱格爾運動隨時隨地都可做。

sentences.english: Remember you can do it anytime in any place.
sentences.chinese: 記住你可以隨時隨地練習。

sentences.english: Would you mind not spitting everywhere?
Read this book and promote it wherever you can.
sentences.chinese: 你應該隨時隨地的閱讀和宣傳這本書。

sentences.english: He got further steamed up about reporters who followed him everywhere, everywhen.
sentences.chinese: 他對那些隨時隨地跟着他的記者暴跳如雷。

sentences.english: Make positive self-suggestions whenever you can.
sentences.chinese: 隨時隨地做積極的自我暗示。

sentences.english: They revolutionized the workers and peasants at all times and in all places.
sentences.chinese: 他們隨時隨地向工人和農民灌輸革命思想。

sentences.english: Since you can sing anywhere, you can express your love of God anywhere.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你開始唱歌，你就能隨時隨地表達你對上帝的愛。

definition: one move, two gains (idiom); two birds with one stone
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to recognize people (of babies)/to be able to tell people apart
to walk around/to move about/to stretch one's legs/to go for a walk/to be mobile (e.g. after an illness)/to visit one another/to pay a visit (go to the toilet)
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
head of a flight of stairs
